definition: to cheat/to swindle/to deceive/to get on (a horse etc) by swinging one leg over

sentences.english: The company boondoggled investors into a low-interest project.
sentences.chinese: 這家公司誆騙投資者向一項低息工程投資。

sentences.english: These advertisements con you into thinking their products the best.
sentences.chinese: 這些廣告誆騙你，使你相信他們的產品都是最好的。

sentences.english: But before he left, Summerville accused Nora of leading him on, and swore vengeance.
sentences.chinese: 索姆威勒臨走前，抱怨勞拉誆騙了他，併發誓要報復。

sentences.english: Those men were scheming to cheat the government by bringing the jewels into the country without paying duty.
sentences.chinese: 那些人不繳關稅將珠寶帶入國境，圖謀以此誆騙政府。

sentences.english: Was the father of psychoanalysis a fraud?
sentences.chinese: 心理分析學之父難道是一個誆騙之徒？。。。
